ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC SGPIE <option(s)>; 
    DONUT category-variable </option(s)> ; 
    KEYLEGEND </option(s)>; 
    PIE category-variable</option(s)>
    STYLEATTRS </option(s)>
    
The SGPIE procedure produces pie charts and donut charts. The angles of pie and donut slices 
are used to graphically represent the value of a statistic for a data range. The charts are 
useful for examining how the values of a variable contribute to the whole and for quickly 
comparing the values of several variables. 

Note: The SGPIE procedure is a preproduction feature in the SAS 9.4M6 release, which means 
that it has not been fully developed, tested, or documented.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DATA=input-data-set]
      
Specifies the SAS data set that contains the variables to process. By default, the procedure 
uses the most recently created SAS data set.

[Syntax: DATTRMAP=discrete-attr-map-data-set]
      
Specifies the discrete attribute map data set that you want to use with the procedure. 
You specify this option only if you are using a discrete attribute map to control visual 
attributes of the graph.

Restriction:
The procedures do not support attribute maps that reside in CAS in-memory tables. 
Only standard SAS data sets are supported for attribute map data. 

Requirement:
The values in the DATTRMAP data set must be sorted by ID. If they are not, only the 
first value is found.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION= "text-string" | DES= "text-string"] 
      
Specifies a description for the output image. The description identifies the image in the 
following locations:

  o the Results window 
  o the alternate text for the image in HTML output 
  o the table of contents that is created by the CONTENTS option in an ODS statement

The default description is "The SGPIE Procedure".

Disables automatic legends from being generated. By default, legends are created automatically 
for some plots, depending on their content. This option has no effect if you specify a 
KEYLEGEND statement.
Specifies that the graph background is opaque.
Specifies that the graph background is transparent.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DONUT category-variable </option(s)>; 
      
Creates a donut chart with slices representing counts or percents of unique category values. 
If a RESPONSE variable is specified, the chart summarizes the category values over corresponding 
values of the RESPONSE variable.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ATTRID=character-value] 
          
Specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set. You specify 
this option only if you are using an attribute map to control visual attributes of the graph.

[Syntax: DATALABELATTRS=style-element <(options)> | (options)]
          
Specifies the color and font attributes of the slice labels. You can specify the appearance 
by using a style element or by specifying specific options. If you specify a style element, 
you can also specify options to override specific appearance attributes.

[Syntax: DATALABELDISPLAY=ALL | NONE | (content-options)] 
          
Specifies he information to display in the slice labels.

(content-options) 
a space-separated list of one or more of the following options enclosed in parentheses: 
CATEGORY 
  displays the category value. 
RESPONSE 
  displays the sum of the response value for each category. If no response variable is specified, 
  displays the category value. 
PERCENT
  displays either of the following: 
  when a response variable is specified, displays the response sum as a percentage. 
  when no response variable is specified, displays the category frequency as a percentage.

[Syntax: DATALABELLOC=INSIDE | OUTSIDE | CALLOUT ] 
          
Specifies whether to display the slice labels within the slices or outside of the donut circumference.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Locates the slice labels inside the pie slices.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Locates the slice labels outside of the pie circumference.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Locates the slice labels outside of the pie circumference and draws a line from the label to its slice.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DATASKIN= NONE | CRISP | GLOSS | MATTE | PRESSED | SHEEN 
          
Enhances the visual appearance of the filled donut slices. 

Default: NONE 

Restriction:The maximum number of skinned graphical elements is limited to 200 per plot. When this 
limit is exceeded for a plot, the specified data skin is not applied to that plot. In that case, use 
the DATASKINMAX= option in your ODS GRAPHICS statement to increase the maximum limit.

Syntax: DIRECTION=COUNTERCLOCKWISE | CLOCKWISE

Specifies whether to display the donut slices in counterclockwise or clockwise sequence.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to display the donut slices in counterclockwise sequence.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies to display the donut slices in clockwise sequence.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: HOLELABEL <=variable>]
          
Displays a label for the donut hole.

If you specify a variable, then that variable label is used for the donut hole. If you 
do not specify a variable, then the RESPONSE variable label is used for the donut hole.

[Syntax: HOLELABELATTRS=style-element <(options)> | (options)]
          
Specifies text attributes for the label text in the donut hole. You can specify the appearance 
by using a style element or by specifying specific options. If you specify a style element, you 
can also specify options to override specific appearance attributes.

[Syntax: HOLEVALUE <=number>]
          
Displays a numeric value inside the donut hole. If you specify a number, then that number 
is displayed inside the donut hole. If you do not specify a number, then the sum of the pie 
slices is displayed inside the donut hole.

TipThe label for large values uses an abbreviated numerical value. For example, 1,100,000,000 
is displayed as 1.1B.

[Syntax: HOLEVALUEATTRS=style-element <(options)> | (options)]
          
Specifies text attributes for the value text in the donut hole. You can specify the appearance 
by using a style element or by specifying specific options. If you specify a style element, you 
can also specify options to override specific appearance attributes.

[Syntax: MAXSLICES=positive integer]
          
Specifies the maximum number of slices in the donut. Any remaining slices are consolidated 
into the Other slice.

Default:No maximum is set
Interaction:This option does not control the drawing order of the slices. Slices are drawn as specified by the ORDER= option.

Shows the data for missing category values.

Default:Missing data is not shown.

[Syntax: OTHERFILLATTRS=style-element <(options)> | (options)] 
          
Specifies the fill color and transparency of the Other slice. You can specify the appearance 
by using a style element or by specifying specific options. If you specify a style element, 
you can also specify options to override specific appearance attributes.

options can be one or more of the following attributes:
COLOR=style-reference | color
  specifies the fill color. You can specify colors using the same color schemes that are supported 
  by SAS/GRAPH software. 
  
TRANSPARENCY=number
  specifies the degree of the transparency of the filled area.
  Default: 0

[Syntax: OTHERLABEL="string"
          
Specifies a label for the Other slice.

Default:“OTHER”

[Syntax: OTHERPERCENT=percent-of-total]
          
Collects all category values with response values less than or equal to percent-of-total 
into the Other slice.

Default:Not set
Range:0 to 100

[Syntax: RESPONSE=numeric-variable]
          
Specifies a numeric variable for the response values.

[Syntax: RINGSIZE=value] 
          
Specifies the proportion of the pie radius to be occupied by the donut ring.

Default:0.3
Range0.0 to 1.0

[Syntax: SLICEORDER=DATA | FORMATTED | UNFORMATTED | RESPASC | RESPDESC]
          
Specifies the order of the donut slices.

Default:UNFORMATTED order
Tip:By default, slices are drawn in a counterclockwise direction. You can change this using 
the DIRECTION= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Draws the slices in data order.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Draws the slices in ascending order of the formatted category variable. This option takes effect  when a format has been applied to the category variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Draws the slices in ascending order of the unformatted category variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Draws the slices in ascending summed order of the response variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Draws the slices in descending summed order of the response variable.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: STARTANGLE=degrees]
          
Specifies which degree between 0 and 360 serves as the starting position for the first slice. 
A value of 0 degrees corresponds to the three o'clock position. The degrees value specified 
moves the starting position counterclockwise beginning with the first quadrant of the pie.

Default:0
Range:0 to 360
Tips:To start the first slice in the fourth quadrant of the pie, specify degrees to be greater than 270.
From the starting point specified by this option, the slices are drawn in the direction specified by the
DIRECTION= option.

[Syntax: STARTPOS=CENTER | EDGE]
          
Specifies whether the start angle of the first slice is centered on the slice or on the edge of the slice.

Default:CENTER
Tips:Use the DIRECTION= option to specify the category direction.
Use the STARTANGLE= option to specify the starting angle.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the start angle of the first slice is centered on the slice.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: specifies that the start angle of the first slice is on the edge of the slice.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: URL=character-variable]
          
Specifies an HTML page to be displayed when parts of the plot are selected.

character-variable
  specifies a variable that contains a valid HTML page reference (HREF) for each plot 
  element that is to have an active link.

  Example:http://www.sas.com

Default:By default, no HTML links are created.
Interactions:This option affects graphics output that is created through the ODS HTML destination 
  only. For more information about ODS destinations, see Specifying ODS Destinations.
  This option has no effect unless you also specify IMAGEMAP in the ODS GRAPHICS statement. 
  For example, add the following statement before your procedure:
    
  ODS GRAPHICS ON / IMAGEMAP=ON;

[Syntax: ACROSS= n] 
          
Specifies the number of columns in the legend. 

Default: Determined automatically

Note: Depending on the number of legend entries and the number of columns and rows that you 
specify, the legend might not fit in your graph. If your legend does not appear, then you might 
need to specify a different value for the ACROSS= option.

Tip:The DOWN= option specifies the number of rows in the legend.

Specifies all swatches in the legend are sized in proportion to the font size used for the legend 
value labels. These proportional sizes take effect regardless of the attributes that are used in 
the plot.
Specifies that borders are displayed around the legend.
Specifies that no borders are displayed around the legend.

[Syntax: DOWN= n] 
          
Specifies the number of rows in the legend.

Default: Determined automatically

Note: Depending on the number of legend entries and the number of columns and rows that you 
specify, the legend might not fit in your graph. If your legend does not appear, then you might 
need to specify a different value for the DOWN= option.

TipThe ACROSS= option specifies the number of columns in the legend.

[Syntax: GOLDEN | positive-number]
          
Specifies an aspect ratio for the fill swatches based on their height.

Note: This feature applies to the third maintenance release of SAS 9.4 and to later releases.

  GOLDEN
    specifies the golden ratio of 1.618 (width = 1.618 * height).
  positive-number
    specifies a custom aspect ratio.
    
Default:The system determines the aspect.
Interaction:This option is ignored when AUTOITEMSIZE is specified.
Tip:Use FILLHEIGHT= to specify the height.

[Syntax: FILLHEIGHT= dimension]
          
Specifies the height of the fill swatches. You can also specify the unit of measure. 

Note: This feature applies to the third maintenance release of SAS 9.4 and to later releases.

Default:The system determines the height.
Interaction:This option is ignored when AUTOITEMSIZE is specified.
Tip:Use FILLASPECT= to specify the aspect ratio.

[Syntax: POSITION=position-value] 
          
Specifies the position of the legend within the graph. 

Default: BOTTOM
Note: By default, if you use more than one KEYLEGEND statement, then each legend is placed in a different position.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places the legend at the bottom of the graph.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Places the legend at the bottom left corner of the graph.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Places the legend at the bottom right corner of the graph.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Places the legend at the left side of the graph.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Places the legend at the right side of the graph.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Places the legend at the top of the graph.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Places the legend at the top left corner of the graph.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Places the legend at the top right corner of the graph.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SCALE=positive-number]
          
Specifies a scale factor that is to be applied to the fill swatch height. Values greater than 1 increase 
the height while values less than 1 reduce the height.

Default:
Interaction:This option is ignored when AUTOITEMSIZE is specified.

Tips:Use FILLHEIGHT= to change the base height.
      Use FILLASPECT= to specify the width.

[Syntax: SORTORDER=ASCENDING | DESCENDING | REVERSEAUTO]
          
Specifies the sort order to use for the legend entry labels. The REVERSEAUTO value reverses 
the order of the legend entry labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies an ascending sort order for the legend entry labels.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies a descending sort order for the legend entry labels.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Reverses the order of the legend entry labels.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TITLE= "text-string"] 
          
Specifies a title for the legend. The title is placed to the left of the legend body, 
except in the following cases:

  o the legend contains two or more rows of items
  o the legend title length exceeds the space that is available on the left side of the legend
In those cases, the title is placed above the legend body.

Default:No title
Requirement:text-string must be enclosed in quotation marks.

[Syntax: style-element <(options)> | (options)]
          
Specifies the appearance of the title. You can specify the appearance by using a style element 
or by using suboptions. If you specify a style element, you can also specify suboptions to override 
specific appearance attributes. 

Default: GraphValueText style element in the current style. The affected attributes are Color, 
  FontFamily, FontSize, FontStyle, and FontWeight.

[Syntax: VALUEATTRS=style-element <(options)> | (options)]
          
Specifies the appearance of the legend value labels. You can specify the appearance by using 
a style element or by using suboptions. If you specify a style element, you can also specify 
suboptions to override specific appearance attributes.

Default: GraphValueText style element in the current style. The affected attributes are Color, 
  FontFamily, FontSize, FontStyle, and FontWeight.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PIE category-variable </option(s)>;
      
Creates a pie chart with slices representing counts or percents of unique category values. 
If a RESPONSE variable is specified, the chart summarizes the category values over corresponding 
values of the RESPONSE variable.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ATTRID=character-value] 
          
Specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set. You specify 
this option only if you are using an attribute map to control visual attributes of the graph.

[Syntax: DATALABELATTRS=style-element <(options)> | (options)]
          
Specifies the color and font attributes of the slice labels. You can specify the appearance 
by using a style element or by specifying specific options. If you specify a style element, 
you can also specify options to override specific appearance attributes.

[Syntax: DATALABELDISPLAY=ALL | NONE | (content-options)] 
          
Specifies he information to display in the slice labels.

(content-options) 
a space-separated list of one or more of the following options enclosed in parentheses: 
CATEGORY 
  displays the category value. 
RESPONSE 
  displays the sum of the response value for each category. If no response variable is specified, 
  displays the category value. 
PERCENT
  displays either of the following: 
  when a response variable is specified, displays the response sum as a percentage. 
  when no response variable is specified, displays the category frequency as a percentage.

[Syntax: DATALABELLOC=INSIDE | OUTSIDE | CALLOUT ] 
          
Specifies whether to display the slice labels within the slices or outside of the donut circumference.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Locates the slice labels inside the pie slices.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Locates the slice labels outside of the pie circumference.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Locates the slice labels outside of the pie circumference and draws a line from the label to its slice.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DATASKIN= NONE | CRISP | GLOSS | MATTE | PRESSED | SHEEN 
          
Enhances the visual appearance of the filled pie slices. 

Default: NONE 

Restriction:The maximum number of skinned graphical elements is limited to 200 per plot. When this 
limit is exceeded for a plot, the specified data skin is not applied to that plot. In that case, use 
the DATASKINMAX= option in your ODS GRAPHICS statement to increase the maximum limit.

Syntax: DIRECTION=COUNTERCLOCKWISE | CLOCKWISE

Specifies whether to display the pie slices in counterclockwise or clockwise sequence.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to display the pie slices in counterclockwise sequence.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies to display the pie slices in clockwise sequence.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: MAXSLICES=positive integer]
          
Specifies the maximum number of slices in the pie. Any remaining slices are consolidated 
into the Other slice.

Default:No maximum is set
Interaction:This option does not control the drawing order of the slices. Slices are drawn as specified by the ORDER= option.

Shows the data for missing category values.

Default:Missing data is not shown.

[Syntax: OTHERFILLATTRS=style-element <(options)> | (options)] 
          
Specifies the fill color and transparency of the Other slice. You can specify the appearance 
by using a style element or by specifying specific options. If you specify a style element, 
you can also specify options to override specific appearance attributes.

options can be one or more of the following attributes:
COLOR=style-reference | color
  specifies the fill color. You can specify colors using the same color schemes that are supported 
  by SAS/GRAPH software. 
  
TRANSPARENCY=number
  specifies the degree of the transparency of the filled area.
  Default: 0

[Syntax: OTHERLABEL="string"
          
Specifies a label for the Other slice.

Default:“OTHER”

[Syntax: OTHERPERCENT=percent-of-total]
          
Collects all category values with response values less than or equal to percent-of-total 
into the Other slice.

Default:Not set
Range:0 to 100

[Syntax: RESPONSE=numeric-variable]
          
Specifies a numeric variable for the response values.

[Syntax: SLICEORDER=DATA | FORMATTED | UNFORMATTED | RESPASC | RESPDESC]
          
Specifies the order of the donut slices.

Default:UNFORMATTED order
Tip:By default, slices are drawn in a counterclockwise direction. You can change this using 
the DIRECTION= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Draws the slices in data order.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Draws the slices in ascending order of the formatted category variable. This option takes effect  when a format has been applied to the category variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Draws the slices in ascending order of the unformatted category variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Draws the slices in ascending summed order of the response variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Draws the slices in descending summed order of the response variable.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: STARTANGLE=degrees]
          
Specifies which degree between 0 and 360 serves as the starting position for the first slice. 
A value of 0 degrees corresponds to the three o'clock position. The degrees value specified 
moves the starting position counterclockwise beginning with the first quadrant of the pie.

Default:0
Range:0 to 360
Tips:To start the first slice in the fourth quadrant of the pie, specify degrees to be greater than 270.
From the starting point specified by this option, the slices are drawn in the direction specified by the
DIRECTION= option.

[Syntax: STARTPOS=CENTER | EDGE]
          
Specifies whether the start angle of the first slice is centered on the slice or on the edge of the slice.

Default:CENTER
Tips:Use the DIRECTION= option to specify the category direction.
Use the STARTANGLE= option to specify the starting angle.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the start angle of the first slice is centered on the slice.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: specifies that the start angle of the first slice is on the edge of the slice.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: URL=character-variable]
          
Specifies an HTML page to be displayed when parts of the plot are selected.

character-variable
  specifies a variable that contains a valid HTML page reference (HREF) for each plot 
  element that is to have an active link.

  Example:http://www.sas.com

Default:By default, no HTML links are created.
Interactions:This option affects graphics output that is created through the ODS HTML destination 
  only. For more information about ODS destinations, see Specifying ODS Destinations.
  This option has no effect unless you also specify IMAGEMAP in the ODS GRAPHICS statement. 
  For example, add the following statement before your procedure:
    
  ODS GRAPHICS ON / IMAGEMAP=ON;

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: STYLEATTRS <option(s)>;

Specifies attributes for a graph. The statement enables you to change the appearance of some graphics 
elements within the procedure.

Requirement:The procedure must include at least one chart statement.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BACKCOLOR=color]
          
Specifies the background color of the graph area. You can specify colors using a number 
of different color-naming schemes. For more information, see Color-Naming Schemes.

Default:The Color attribute of the GraphBackground style element.

[Syntax: DATACOLORS=(color-list)] 
          
Specifies the fill colors for the graphics elements. 

Provide a space-separated list of colors enclosed in parentheses. You can specify colors using the 
same color schemes that are supported by SAS/GRAPH software.

Default: The colors that are defined in the GraphData1...GraphDatan style elements in the 
current style are used.
